docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This lib (v2024.1) is used to manage ch376 chip for 6502 cpu

docs.title: ch376_check_exist
docs.text:
Description

If ch376 is present, it will return $AA

Returns

  • Accumulator : $AA if it's OK

Example

 jsr ch376_check_exist
cmp #$AA
beq @exists
rts ; Does not exist
@exists:
...

docs.title: ch376_dir_create
docs.text:
Description

create a folder

Returns

  • Accumulator : ch376 status values

Example

 jsr ch376_dir_create
; check accumulator here ch376_wait_response had been launched by ch376_dir_create

docs.title: ch376_disk_mount
docs.text:
Description

perform a disk mount

Returns

  • Accumulator : ch376 status values

Example

 jsr ch376_disk_mount
; check accumulator here ch376_wait_response had been launched by ch376_disk_mount

docs.title: ch376_file_close
docs.text:
Description

Close file

Returns

  • Accumulator : 'ch376 status' value

Example

 jsr ch376_file_close
; check accumulator here ch376_wait_response had been launched by ch376_file_close

docs.title: ch376_file_create
docs.text:
Description

create file

Returns

Example

 jsr ch376_file_create
; check accumulator here ch376_wait_response had been launched by ch376_file_create

open file

Example

docs.title: ch376_get_descr
docs.text:
Description

Get usb descr device

Returns

  • Accumulator : ch376 status values

Example

 jsr ch376_get_descr
; check accumulator here ch376_wait_response had been launched by ch376_get_descr

docs.title: ch376_ic_get_ver
docs.text:
Description

get version

Returns

  • Accumulator : ch376 firmware version

Example

 jsr ch376_ic_get_ver
; check accumulator for Version (integer value)

docs.title: ch376_lib_version
docs.text:
Description

Get lib version

Returns

  • Accumulator : ch376 lib version

Example

 jsr ch376_lib_version
cmp #CH376_LIB_VERSION_2024_2
beq @right_version
; Wrong version
...
rts
@right_version:
...
rts

docs.title: ch376_seek_file
docs.text:
Description

Seek file. Performs a wait_response

Input

  • Accumulator : First byte
  • Y Register : second byte
  • X Register : third byte byte

Returns

  • Accumulator : ch376 status values

Example

 lda #$04
sta RES
lda #$01
ldy #$02
ldx #$03
jsr ch376_seek_file
; check accumulator here ch376_wait_response had been launched by ch376_seek_file

Not tested

docs.title: ch376_set_config
docs.text:
Description

set config for usb device

Input

  • Accumulator : config value Example
 lda #$02
jsr ch376_set_config

docs.title: ch376_set_file_name
docs.text:
Description

set file_name

Input

  • Accumulator : Low ptr adress of the string, terminated by 0
  • Y Register : High ptr adress of the string, terminated by 0 Example
 lda #<myfile
ldy #>myfile
jsr ch376_set_file_name
rts
myfile:
.byte "hello.txt"

docs.title: ch376_set_usb_addr
docs.text:
Description

set usb_address

Input

  • Accumulator : The address to set Example
 lda #$02
jsr ch376_set_usb_addr
rts

docs.title: ch376_set_usb_mode
docs.text:
Description

Set usb mode

Input

  • Accumulator : The usb mode to set Example

```ca65 lda #CH376_USB_MODE_HOST_RESET jsr ch376_set_usb_mode rts

docs.title: ch376_set_usb_speed
docs.text:
Description

Set usb mode

Input

  • Accumulator : The speed for usb Example

```ca65 lda #$02 jsr ch376_set_usb_speed rts

docs.title: ch376_wait_response
docs.text:
Description

Perform wait_response. It's not needed to call because some commands already perform ch376_wait_response

Returns

  • Accumulator : "ch376 status" value (or return 1 if usb controller does not respond)

Example

```ca65 jsr ch376_wait_response rts

docs.title: unsigned char ch376_check_exist(void);
docs.text:
Description

If ch376 is present, it will return 0XAA

Returns

0XAA if it's OK
